Reviews.Title: “The view is spectacular”
Reviews.Author: 463KateS
Reviews.Content: The view from the apartment was amazing and the apartment was well appointed. A convenient ferry ride to wherever you need to get to. The only downfalls were the pool was freezing (don't think it was heated at all) and there was absolutely no tourist information availalbe at the place. Front desk staff were not over friendly either which made you feel as if every question was an intrusion. However we would stay again....for the view.

Reviews.Title: “The views are spectacular - well appointed accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jonothan_and_Elaine
Reviews.Content: We loved the Harbourside Apartments. Friendly, relaxed and efficient Aussie service. The apartment we had was fantastic (No.17 on the fifth floor). Simply but very tastefully furnished. But the views and position are what make this place special. VERY conveniently situated for the ferry at McMahon's Point, so it's a short hop across to either Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. The villagey atmosphere of Blues Point Road with its shops and restaurants is but a short walk away (though uphill, at least it's downhill coming back!). The rainbow lorikeets tapping on the kitchen window for breakfast weren't an advertised amenity, but they were very welcome! A great place to relax and kick back if you're visiting Sydney. Though not cheap, it's well worth the money. We would definitely return, and I would add that the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Almost do not want to review this one ......”
Reviews.Author: Raine1960
Reviews.Content: I have decided that I can't keep this one to myself any longer! Our family have been staying at these serviced apartments for more than 25 years now and we still think it is the best place to stay in Sydney! Just a short ferry ride from Circular Quay lands you at McMahons Point jetty and from there just a two minute walk! From the outside, the building is nothing flash but you just cannot beat its position. Across the harbour from Luna Park, and a short twist of the neck sees you staring through the Harbour Bridge to the Opera House. The rooms with Harbour views can entertain you for quite a while just watching the traffic and life on the harbour - beautiful at both sunrise and sunset. There is a lovely pool and BBQ area which our families all use every time we come. You can sit with a lovely glass of wine and watch the end of the day over the harbour. Some of the apartments have been renovated recently and some are still in need of it but overall are clean, well equipped and a good size. If you absolutely have to have airconditioning then don't book here. Some of the apartments have ceiling fans but really when you open the windows there is little need for aircon! There are numerous cafes and pubs a good appetite inducing short walk up Blues Point Rd and a number of these establishments will deliver. All in all a fabulous place for all kinds of stays - especially when you have visitors from overseas.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay this time, comfortable room and hard to beat the lovely location”
Reviews.Author: nina99Sydney
Reviews.Content: My last review had not been great with a poor room, not clean. But all was good this time with the standard of comfort and cleanliness that make for a food stay. Of course, hard to find a more lovely, quiet and central place on Sydney Harbourside. Recommend a take away pizza or curry from Blues Point if you want to kick back and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Not great this time sadly, but I will give it another go due to the location and previous stays.”
Reviews.Author: nina99Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is my Sydney stay of choice due to the location, convenience, simple comfort and good prices. However, my most recent stay was a bit of a let down. The apartment was dirty with furniture in the wrong place. No other apartments were available so the reception staff did their best to clean up whilst I had to go out. Although the place was cleaner on my return I was not convinced that the bedding was fresh - probably just paranoia! The hot water was provided by an unflued gas heater so there was a bit of a smell and a sooty ceiling in one corner. I have had good experiences here so will try again but this is a bit of a hit and miss place and next time I hope for a hit!

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: Glyn T
Reviews.Content: We rented four apartments for our son's wedding last weekend. It was great. The apartments were on varying levels at varying prices. They were all spacious, clean and well equipped. The views from our top floor one were truly amazing. The location is great, with the ferry into central Sydney right there. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful, and we were made to feel welcome. The only minor negative is the lack of free or reasonably priced internet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Views in Sydney!!!”
Reviews.Author: MeINparadise
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harbourside Apartments for a few nights and enjoyed every minute of it. The location is very special-right on the Harbour and the views are to die for! The ferry terminal is 50 meters from the reception and McMahons village is about 10 minutes stroll. The apartment I stayed at was very spacious and was nicely decorated, the beds were very comfy and the towels were of superb quality. I felt very well looked after by the staff of Harbourside Apartments. Also a free car park was an excellent addition. PS. I still can't decide-was the view from my apartment better during the day or during the night? Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Another milestone in the continuing quest for the best view in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PJLBewdy
Reviews.Content: I have always said that I would rather be in North Sydney with a view of the City than be in the City with a view of North Sydney. We have often stayed at the Harbourview and until recently I considered that the Harbourview had the best views in Sydney. I now pass the 'best view' mantle to Harbourside Apartments and will recommend this accommodation to anyone, with a couple of caveats. We stayed two nights on 19 & 20 August. Reception - Entering the grounds has a strong wow factor . Initial impression is strongly positive but then we enter the Lobby which is microscopic and realise that this is self catering apartments not a hotel. Reception is friendly and professional but limited. There are only one or two staff and if you have a problem they may not be able to fix it right away - fortunately the system worked for us and we arrived in our one bedroom apartment on the 14th floor without incident. I was able to secure the last car parking space on the grounds. Apparently they have undercover parking as well but I never learnt how to access it. The immediate reaction when entering the apartment is .. "oh my God! Look at this view! It certainly would be hard to find a better outlook in Sydney. Fixtures and fittings were slightly worn but functional - ditto the kitchen. I was quite happy with the instant coffee sachets provided but my wife thought that the trendy, London labelled 'fair trade' tea tasted pretty bad. I had to pull our bed out from the wall and plug in one of the bedside lights that hadn't been plugged in (or more likely unplugged by some inconsiderate guest using electronic equipment in the bedroom and not plugged in again.) Bathroom was small but clean. Toiletry products offered were of a good standard. Water pressure was quite low although not bad enough to warrant a complaint. There was a small flat screen TV that we never turned on and heating from a couple of Oil column heaters that was more than adequate. Guest information provided would be helpful to those unfamiliar with the City. There is an internet facility as well but once again we didn't use it. Bed was very comfortable and linen was of high quality. We found the many eateries of Blues Point offered a good range of eating and drinking options. Much better than the soulless concrete canyon that is North Sydney after 7 pm. Good points The view!! The location - ferry at your door Good bed Quiet Not So Good No frills service - if you want hotel service it's probably best to stay in a hotel. You will need to bring food and drink or go out to eat and drink. They have a breakfast hamper available but I'm not sure that it is great value. Price - we paid $478 for a 1 bedroom harbour view apartment for two nights and this is the cheapest time of year. Overall - I think we'll stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Dismissive reception staff”
Reviews.Author: 3sistersplus1
Reviews.Content: A recent stay at the Harbourside Apartments was spoiled by the attitude of two of the reception staff. They were dismissive and unapolegetic when several problems were brought to their attention including not providing the type of accomodation booked, a leaking toilet and lack of hot water and pressure in the shower. The views and location were great but furnishings tired, worn and torn. The apartment was cold on arrival with the only heating being a plug-in electric heater found in the bedroom wardrobe.This establishment needs to improve its customer service rather than just relying on fantastic views for patronage. It needs to accept responsibility for and try to amend any problems that may arise rather than just dismissing them. It is interesting to see that several other reviewers have also noted the reception staff's attitude and manner to be less than desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Location wonderful. Views spectacular. Service Mmmm”
Reviews.Author: bobbysophie
Reviews.Content: Arriving Friday afternoon excited about a Sydney reunion for Mother (>70yrs) and three daughters (>50yrs) (all travelling into Sydney) the first disappointment was the two bedroom harbourview apartment booked was not available due to plumbing problems. No ones fault, these things happen. However, I found reception dismissive and unapologetic about the problem. We were accommodated in two seperate 1bedroom apartments. Both 1bedroom apartments had plumbing issues - one leaking toilet, the other with tepid shower water. Our weekend reunion resulted in the strategic planning of remembering the room swip cards between rooms/visits and walking the corridor in PJ's for forgotten bits and pieces. Not really my idea of a relaxing reunion weekend for four mature ladies. Normally when the client is inconvenienced the offer of an upgrade, discount or freebie such as breakfast may be the order of the day. I walk away amazed by the specatular views, happy with the location, disappointed with reception. As a frequent visitor to Sydney I can tick the Harbourside apartments off the list. The bottom line is, I dont believe we received value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I will not be staying in these apartments again.”
Reviews.Author: maumie
Reviews.Content: I originally booked a two bedroom unit to accommodate 4 adults but due to on site plumbing issues our party was relocated to two separate units. We were informed no plumber was available until the Monday to carry out such repairs. The two units allocated were both were unsatisfactory: the 1st had only luke warm water with little pressure. The unit was cold with no more than a portable heater. The 2nd unit had a leaking toilet leaving a large puddle to navigate. The staff were not engaging when these problems were presented and minimised the complaint. Whilst the view is spectacular that's the only positive experience from our stay and we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but little bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Klobas
Reviews.Content: The location is simply amazing, that's the biggest advantage and only excuse for quite high price. However you will have Sydney Opera and Harbour Bridge at your front door, just across the Sydney Harbour. As the ferry stop is 1 minute walk from the hotel, you will get to city center in ~15 minutes and you will avoid all the traffic jam. Staff was polite, nice and helpful. Room are also nice, but maybe a little bit older than I was expecting. I spent 3 months there and I can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views but grotty”
Reviews.Author: hawera
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor we were very clear in our communications wiht this place that we wanted a renovated apartment with a good view. We got the view but the apartment was grotty - even the toilet seat was peeling (I didn't know that they could even do that!!), the paintwork was grotty, bashed, the carpets were stained and disgusting, chairs aged and grotty. We asked to change apartments and were shown some that had been done up - but none would fit us and our children and even the upgraded apartments had disgusting dirty carpets that you wouldn't even expect in an 2* motel. On the plus side the beds were cofortable and the linen was good quality. We were told they were happy for us to go and find somewhere else - not an easy thing to do at 8pm wiht children during the Easter holidays, so we stayed put. We tried to contact the manager but were told they were unavailable each day of our 3 night stay.For the price it was a huge disappointment. Save your money and stay somewhere els.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to celebrate our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: Pattisharpe
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Harbourside Apartments. After a long drive my husband and I could not believe the view. I have never seen any thing like it! I could almost reach out and touch the bridge. The reception staff were very helpful. The cafes were a 10 minute walk away however, it was up a long flight of steps. There is a local bus that does go past the cafes during business hours. Our one bedroom apartment was clean, comfortable and had a wonderful view. It was serviced daily, tea, coffee supllied, crisp linen and wonderful fluffy towels. The kitchen would be convenient if you wanted to cook. Our car was parked in the carpark - at no charge, we used the ferry to go into the city. We had a BBQ by the pool for dinner while "we watched the world go by". The pool looked lovely. I booked directly over the phone and was given a great rate. Summed up, we could not have selected a better place to celebrate our silver wedding anniveresary. We can wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Still can not believe our good fortune”
Reviews.Author: koa41
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Harbourside Apartments for a recent family reunioun. We live on the Central Coast but most of our family were coming from overseas so we wanted to impress them with our local hospitality and the beauty of Sydney Harbour. We chose Harbourside as we wanted to be in a peaceful beautiful location close to Sydney Harbour . We hit jackpot. Harbourside was everything and more than we imagined. My cousins think Sydney is spectacular and every Aussie is as friendly as the staff at Harbourside. They also think my wife and I are brilliant for selecting such fabulous accommodation. We were all together (20 of us) yet remained independent in our own apartments. The girls on reception were wonderful and assisted with any small detail to make our days easy and as much fun as possible. The ferry is at the front door. Golly. I am so happy to have found this place and will continue to sing its praises, hence this review. This place is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Notafusspot
Reviews.Content: Staff were the most unfriendly we have ever come across. We travelled from London and for our 2 week stay were treated like unpopular and unwanted guests. We spent thousands staying there to be near family who live nearby but in all that time were never greeted kindly or warmly . It took away from our Sydney experience. Stay at nearby milsons point for lots of choice and happy welcoming people. Harbourside is dated with few amenities. We were bitterly disappointed and would strongly advise you to stay somewhere , where they appreciate your choice of accommodation and treat you with respect. We are not youngsters, not that that would be a reason for across the board rudness, these people don't think they have to try because of the view. Same view kirribilli and milsons point. More to do and great transport.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to beat”
Reviews.Author: salmoneater
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harbourside many times over about 15 years. It remains our first choice for Sydney (although, to be honest, we are so satisfied with Harbourside that we haven't stayed anywhere else in Sydney for some time - but comparing prices and locations and facilities it still seems to be good value). We were there for a week in October 2010 and again for 4 nights in November, in studio apartments with harbour view. The apartments with view are a must really - the perfect view of the harbour, Bridge and Opera House (although best views are from below about floor 13, because from greater height the Bridge deck starts to chop off the top of the OHouse, quite spoiling one's photos). We have always found the staff helpful, although the quality of help and interaction can be variable. The general standard of H'side sometimes shows its age, but apartments are constantly upgraded, and both the ones we had were modern, new and clean. Each has a small kitchen, basically equipped, and there are laundry facilities on alternate floors. There's Sails restaurant right outside the door, and Blues Point Road is a 5-minute walk away (up-hill) with delis and minimarkets, post office, hairdressers, wineshops and other shops, many restaurants (try Delicado) and two pubs. The bus from just outside H'side will take you up there, or a bit further on to North Sydney with all shops and facilities you could want. So you can eat out or shop and cook in the apartment - or on the poolside BBQ. All in all, it seems difficult to beat, and several friends to whom we have recommended H'side agree. (Oh, and come on, Andrew from Shoreham, please let's not have everywhere in the world airconditioned! There's usually plenty of air movement through the windows.) (And come on, Harbourside - $22 for 24 hours Internet is ludicrously expensive!)

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay at Harbourside Apartments when emigrating to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Peters38
Reviews.Content: On emigrating to Sydney, our first impression was built on the extremely unfriendly and un-customer service oriented staff at Harbourside Apartments. We were treated with disdain even though we spent over $10,000 there. We couldnt leave soon enough. in short the rooms are overpriced, the overall service terrible and there was no value for money. The only advantage is it proximity to the ferry, but there are plenty of other serviced apartments in Kiribili which would have to be better.

Reviews.Title: “View, location and ambiance, what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: Dreams64
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have just returned to Melbourne from our first trip to Sydney and my husband and I highly recommend this hotel. The staff were lovely and nothing was too much trouble for them. We arrived early and the staff looked after our bags all day before we arrived back later just before dinner, again on the last day we were able to leave the bags all day. The rooms are clean and comfortable and have everything you need. Homemade muffins on the way out each morning were both a delight and much appreciated. It is obvious that the drawcard of this hotel is the view - it is simply spectacular both day and night. The location is also a plus especially if you dont have a car - you are metres away from a jetty where ferrys frequently dock well into the evening and go to all tourist spots as well as circular quay which will allow you to catch other ferries, or buses or trains to anywhere you pleased. We loved our time at Harrbouside and will be recommending it to others for sure.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: Saschi101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbourside for three nights when my regular North Sydney accommodation was booked out (quite common in this part of town at certain times of the year). Wanting to be close to work, I tried the Harbourside Apartments and didn't regret my choice. Other reviewers have pointed out that the apartment quality can be hit-and-miss. I was very happy with the ground floor apartment I was given. It was to the side of the complex, so I was able to enter from street level and not reception. Although initially somewhat concerned about the ground floor location (especially as it's right near the ferry stop), the complex is generally secure and I felt perfectly safe at night. I've stayed in three North Sydney hotels and the facades are generally dated. The interior of my apartment at Harbourside was also dated, but highly functional. I had everything I needed and the apartment was very comfortable. The lack of frills (read: self-catering) was perfect for me as I enjoy the change from room service meals when I'm away for work. The location is great for leisure, but unless you're driving, bussing or taking cabs, it's an uphill walk to the North Sydney CBD. This didn't bother me, but it should be taken into account. I've always been a fan of McMahon's Point, so the location was perfect for me - a vast improvement on the relatively soulless North Sydney CBD (especially after work hours). Restaurants and shops are a 5-10 minute (uphill) walk. The complex has a pool, but no fitness facilities. That said, there are several walks you can do and given the spectacular location, they're highly recommended. The setting is lovely - you're right on the harbour. I was able to step out of my apartment and take in the wonderful views. Even though I travel to Sydney often, I can never get enough of the beautiful harbour. The ferry is nearby and a fifteen minute walk (or five minute cab or ten minute bus trip) will take you to North Sydney Station. From there, you can get the train over the bridge to the CBD (10 mins). For those who enjoy self-catering and don't mind relatively basic facilities, this hotel would be great. I enjoyed my stay at the Harbourside and would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “NO AIR”
Reviews.Author: andrewhShoreham
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning in Sydney in January is not on. For A$520 per night for a very small 2 bedroom apartment with a nightmare carpark unhelpful staff is overpriced, even if the view is great. to be told that because the website does not list air conditioning we should not expect is beyond belief. After all it is 2010.

Reviews.Title: “ungracious receptionist”
Reviews.Author: joybellPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from USA. We happened to strike a very unfriendly, ungracious and very unhelpful receptionist. It was an unfortunate start to our stay. The apartment we had was great but her behaviour has coloured our views of the accommodation. We have put our complaints to the management and had a helpful reply but staff like that should never be tolerated.

Reviews.Title: “The Best View for the Best Price”
Reviews.Author: MikLat
Reviews.Content: This Apartment was all about the view. If you want a good view then this is the best deal. The apartment was great, very clean and professional. They provided tea, biscuits, fresh towels, and sheets. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Best of all this place is located in north Sydney. You get a great view of the bridge, opera house, lavender bay, and luna park. If you do not like the craziness and noise of the city then this is the place for you. I would recommend this place to anyone. We only had one weird thing happen. They said they would keep our luggage while we walked around. Their luggage area was the back outside wall hallway with a chain bolted to the wall. The chain was ran through the luggage handles and locked. I was a little worried but they assured me it would be alright. We did not have any issues but it was a weird moment.

Reviews.Title: “lovely apartment with amazing vue's”
Reviews.Author: jd-1988
Reviews.Content: Apon arrival the staff were really friendly and welcoming. apartment was really nice and made to feel really homely and comfortable. but the one thing that took my breath away was the vue from our living room window , the sydney harbour bridge and through the middle of the bridge was the opra house absolutly stunning.

Reviews.Title: “the view was amazing”
Reviews.Author: monksey
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the harbourside apartments for 4 days the apartments were spotless and very close to ferry which made it easy to get back and forth for sightseeing we found the staff very friendly and helpful would stay there again if in sydney

Reviews.Title: “Ex local.”
Reviews.Author: dominator1
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enogh live in Mc Mahons point for a few years. So when we made time for a vist to our old stomping ground I knew the location I wanted. However I have heard from other locals that these apartmnts can be a hit an miss. I was lucky and got a hit. My Lavender bay apartment was great. Sitting on our couch I could see the bridge an opera house so we where very happy-Very clean and the one bedroom works great if you have kids. Tuck them into bed and order some Blue ginger (local lndian) a bottle (or two) of nice red and life is good. Staff seemed good . Stayed 3 nights and was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Apartments in an Awesome Spot”
Reviews.Author: lenamuse
Reviews.Content: The apartments are a bit old-skool and a little rough around the edges here and there, but that just made them feel more homely in my books. Sterile, bland hotel rooms don't actually do that much for me. Seen one; seen them all. The position of Harbourside Apartments can't be beaten. Although we booked what was described as a room with a Lavender Bay view, we had a great view of the Harbour Bridge (maybe we got upgraded). What an amazing view to wake up to! Truly spectacular at 6am (I was on NZ time!) I walked over the Harbour Bridge into the city one day. This was QUITE a walk, but doable, with several coffee stops along the way. On the way home, the ferry delivered me practically at the door of the hotel. Perfect. McMahon's Point is a great place, too. I have now got an ambition to live there one day. It's near enough to the city to be a very short ferry ride, but quiet and beautiful and not like being in the middle of the world's major cities. Oh, and try the pizza place up the road. I can't remember the name of it, but their pizzas are great.

Reviews.Title: “who needs t.v when you can watch the harbour”
Reviews.Author: blackbetty40
Reviews.Content: this was an older style apartment , but the location was so good , you can watch the ferry coming and then run down and hop on . you have to make sure you ask for a harbour view room , if thats what your after , we asked for a one bedroom apartment facing the harbour, and got put in a room facing lavender bay , they changed us to another room after we asked about it , they said there are 2 types of harbour view rooms , the bed was very comfortable and i went to sleep facing the harbour bridge. we cant wait to stay again , the room rate was pretty good for sydney , and the reason we stayed there was the free parking .

Reviews.Title: “Best view ever”
Reviews.Author: farmerjon
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 night stay in this hotel. The location is absolutely fanastic bring situated on the end of Blues Point. The views, WOW. From my room I could see the entire Harbour Bridge and OPera HOuse, city skyline, and Luna pArk tyo the left. Being situated right on the waters edge is a huge plus. Ferry is at your door: 7 minutes to Circular Quay. Staff were an absolute treat, always smiling and very helpful. Pity the reviewer from Dublin criticised the staff as all my interactions with the front desk were pleasant and professional. Liked that the apartments had a more "at home feel" rather than a Hotel. Great selection of cafes up around the corner. Pool right on the waters edge (complete with the picture postcard perfect view), free parking for guests (great for me). Oh, forgot to mention price - Excellent considering location, view and room condition. I liked it so much I'm already planning anothe short break to Sydney soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location with Service to Match”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie_9
Reviews.Content: Just back from Australia and most missing Sydney and the Harbourside Apartments--heaven on earth. We've stayed there on four or five occasions in different apartments. Each has its individual character--from minimalist chic to homely and cosy. All are serviced to a high standard, very clean and offer all the domestic amenities that make staying there home from home--but with that added amazing view across Lavender Bay or across the harbour to the Opera House and Bridge that makes them unequalled as a tourist destination. Then there's the ferry just below at McMahons Point and the handy shops on Blues Point Road which add to the ease of eating out (try Sails restaurant just a few steps away, or Ripples at Milsons Point a two minute ferry ride away). And then there's the swimming pool for days when you feel like languishing, reading a novel and simply soaking up the sun. The staff at the Harbourside are the icing on the cake. Ever friendly, patient and helpful, they make you feel, as you take your leave at the end of your stay, as if it's family you are forsaking. Once we're home we start right away to plan the next trip. As soon as poss....

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable views, superb location”
Reviews.Author: busymother_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I was looking for somewhere nice to stay close to the city but didn't want to pay 5 star prices. Upon arriving at the hotel the check-in was quick and easy. The girl at front desk could have perhaps cracked a smile and wished us a pleasant stay but that was not to be. We stayed in a 1BR harbourview apartment on the 10th floor. The apartment was certainly very clean and tidy. The decor (lounge, furniture, carpet, etc) was old and slightly unappealing; (this put me off a bit). The queen size bed was comfortable but when I went to open the cupboard doors to hang some clothes up, there was a very musty unpleasant smell so decided against using the cupboards. The bathroom was clean and the shower was very good - excellent water pressure out of the nozzle!!! There was a full self-contained kitchen with stove, oven, microwave, fridge, toaster, kettle etc and complimentary tea/coffee/sugar/biscuits but we didn't use it. Now the view was simply unbelievable. You cannot get much better than this! Beautiful views of the opera house, harbour bridge and city lights. What more could you want!! The ferry is at your doorstep which takes you across to circular quay in a matter of minutes. The pool and BBQ area is very nice, although we didn't use it, it would be great on a summers day. So in summary, if you want complete luxury, modern fancy decor and a marble bathroom, then this place is not for you. If you want a 5 star view, 5 star location but don't want to pay 5 star prices, then this hotel would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: Pearcey73
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic view but the staff leave ALOT TO BE DESIRED! Everything was not their problem! The washing machine ruined by clothes, not their problem. I couldnt get the vending machine to work, not their problem. There were bugs in the room which they said they would sort but didnt. I thought the customer comes first but not at Harbourside Apartments Henry Lawson Avenue, I felt like the guests were an inconvience to them. They must assume the view sells the place and they dont need to be nice or polite! I would definatley find another hotel with a view next time rather than give these hitlers my money which they dont deserve

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CL77
Reviews.Content: We were sure that when we were looking for cheap places to stay in Sydney with free parking that we didn't have a chance of finding anywhare nice in a central location. How wrong we were, not only is the parking free but it is in a great location. It is the other side of the harbour to central Sydney but the ferry pick up is literally a 1 minute walk to the bottom of the drive with a 5 minute ferry ride to circular quay. They let us check in early and our room was above what we were expecting. Nice and spacious with a kitchenette and sofa bed. The road it was situated on was great for eating out if you wanted a short walk. Great affordable base for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great views over harbour”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCazzie
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed four days at Harbourside. Have stayed many times in Sydney but will always return to McMahons Point. Just beautiful to wake up to the views of the harbour and bridge and watch the world go by. You can actually hear birds instead of traffic. Blue Point shops and cafes are just a short walk away and the ferry and bus are very convenient if you plan your day by the timetable given to you. I found the staff very friendly and helpful. It is well worth buying a travel pass as soon as you arrive which takes you on ferries,buses and trains otherwise the trip back and forth on the ferry becomes costly. Loved it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service too”
Reviews.Author: Mazzajo
Reviews.Content: The Harbourside Apartments are an excellent place to stay if you have to park a car - for free! - but want easy access to the centre of the Sydney. The ferry stops right outside and so does the bus. Take note, however, of timetables as the bus doesn't seem to run on Sundays, and the last ferry most days is before 8pm. The North Sydney railway Station is not too far away - it's a relatively easy walk down the hill from the station to the hotel, but a strenuous hike up to it! There are a few nice cafes within (uphill) walking distance. And the view is unbeatable. Our room was spotlessly clean. This is an older building, so lots of the fittings (kitchens, doorknobs etc) are rather dated, but still surprisingly pristine. My only criticism is there was neither air conditioning nor a ceiling fan, so take note if you're planning to stay in summer, it might be a little uncomfortable. There are openable windows, but if it's a noisy weekend night at Luna park, you might not want to keep them open. We were upgraded from a studio to a basic one-bedroom apartment, and this was spacious and comfortable enough for a one- week stay. I suspect the studio room (which we booked) might have been rather cramped for more than a day or two. The service was excellent - the staff were helpful and even let us keep our car at the hotel for several hours after checkout until we were ready to leave town. Will definitely stay again, but not during the hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families and those with a car”
Reviews.Author: Lovin_Sydney
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in Sydney with our two children (8 and 3) and my Dad and his girlfriend. We were in a 2 bedroom and 1 bedroom apartment on the 11th floor which both had windows facing frontwards and sidewards so we got the fabulouse views across the harbour as well as Lavender Bay from ours and up river from Dad's. Both our apartments were spacious and well appointed - decor not completely up to date but not stuck in a timewarp either! There was a laundry room on our floor together with a recycling point. A big bonus for us was having free parking - (there is plenty) as we had hired a car for the duration. For days when we stayed within Sydney itself, the ferry stop is literally right outside the apartments and the ferries are frequent and on time. You can actually spot the ferry leaving Circular Quay from your window and head downstairs to be there in time for it arriving from the Luna Park stop. There is also an adjacent bus stop for going up into North Sydney to connect with rail services. The only possible downside is a lack of on site facilities - no bar or restaurant (the Sails restaurant next door was very expensive so we didn't eat there though during our staty it was gutted for a refit) and no internet access unless you have your own laptop. However the Blues Point area just a short walk up the hill has some lovely restaurants and pubs as well as shops and a pizza delivery service was also available to the apartments. There is a decent pool area and barbecue which we didn't use - it seemed to get the sun in the morning when we were usually out and by evening was a bit too shady.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Views”
Reviews.Author: blackjake
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in apartments when travelling with our two children aged 2 and 1 so we can cook for ourselves. We stayed on the 16th floor and had fabulous views of the harbour and the bridge. We were able to see the ferry coming across to our ferry stop (right outside) and then rush down to greet it. The ferry went to Circular quay or Darling Harbour. Very convienient and the best entertainment for small chldren. We bought a weekly pass and found ourselves just going round and round the Harbour. The pool is also marvellous, lying right next to the harbour. The 1 bedroom apartment however is very tired (which is not such a bad thing with small children that are capable of making a mess). The kitchen even lacked a wooden spoon and a decent knife and the internal bathroom has seen better days. The blind in the bedroom fell down when I moved it and it looked like a generation of guests had had it fall down on top of them before delicately balancing it back. The front desk receptionists weren't terribly friendly or helpful and as the apartments are privately owned (with some permanent residents) I guess they feel that short term guests aren't high on their agenda. It is a short walk up the hill to some small shops where we bought some delicious ready made food from a deli. Having a glass of wine while looking at the superb view helps you from looking at the inside of the flat. Having said all of that, it is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary room with great vies”
Reviews.Author: MacguyverCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Proberbly the best view of the Opera House and Bridge you could ever ask for but the room was a bit disapointing. Our studio was fare sized but a bit tired. In a real need of upgrade. But the service was good and you get free parking ( a real bonus in Sydney!) If you need to go into the CBD just hope on the ferry - it is a cheap and wonderful experience to see the city. Do yourself a favour and book the barbie one night. What a view from outside and a good way to make new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding view, if you are prepared to compromise on room standard”
Reviews.Author: Siboyblue
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the apartments in 3 years. Why to do I pick it, well the views are stunning and cannot be obtained by any other hotel in Sydney. The apartments are situated on the north side of the harbour and as previous reviews have stated you are some what isolated. I dispute this somewhat for a number of reasons. 1. A bus service runs up to North Sydney every 15 mins (7am to 6pm Mon to Sat) from McMahons point, a 1 minute walk from the apartments. 2. You can walk up to North Sydney in 15 mins, uphill on way up but great views and a lovely walk. 3. Small local shops and restaurants are dotted all the way up with larger supermarket type shops once your in North Sydney 4. The ferry service is excellent, frequent and on time so getting over the the main city is not only easy, it's great fun and a noval way to travel every day. I stay in a harbour view room, it costs extra but worth it. Cannot rate the other room types. Have had a 1 bedroom a 2 bedroom and this time a newly refurbished studio room. Note that not all the rooms have been done but they do need it as they are a little tired. So check when you book! I have placed pictures on the site so you can see what it looks like. On the plus side the apartments are clean, tidy and quiet at night. You can make use of the outdoor pool from 7am to 10pm each day or have a BBQ in the recreation area. Neither of which I have done. On the downside watch out for the old woman that mans the front desk very early in the morning. She needs to learn some customer service skills. I had a run in with her over the vending machine not giving me a drink when I put in my money. She was very rude and said that it did not belong to them and she could do nothing to help me! It was the way she said it and acted that got me upset! The internet usage fee is also a but of a rip off. $22 per day (not wifi) or $100 for a week there is also a limit on downloads of 80mb a day. There is no air conditioning in the rooms, they do have fans. This may sound like a big issue and could be on really hot days but remember you are by the water so it cools down very nicely at night. So I think it is only a problem if it becomes muggy. All in all the views are stunning, the place is good but not 5 star standard. You are paying for the location but trust me it is worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views”
Reviews.Author: JennyMurray
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Harbourside Apartments. Ferry right outside the door and lovely views of magnificent Sydney Harbour. Whilst a bit isolated (which was what we wanted), we caught the local bus up the hill (a regular service - ties in with the ferries) and bought provisions. We also used the ferries to sightsee around Sydney. Our room was very good, I think recently refurbished. In saying that, when we arrived we were offered a below standard room, dark and with no views, despite the fact that we had been promised a room with a view. This fault was promptly rectified with reception and we ended up with a great room. We initially thought the staff were not particularly warm nor friendly, but after the first impression we found them to be fine. In fact, very helpful and friendly. We will stay again. It's lovely. Jenny Murray, Melbourne

Reviews.Title: “postcard perfect view”
Reviews.Author: treesaregreenperth
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Lavender Bay" view apartment as all of the Harbour view apartments were fuly booked. Paid a reasonable price considering the location and facilities. The apartment had everything we needed, nicely decorated and the view was up to North Sydney and over a pretty bay full of boats. We stayed for 5 days and got up each morning for a swim in the great pool that is right on the water's edge. There were great cafes up the road for brekkie. Staff were really helpful as we hadn't been to Sydney before and they gave us some great tips on the best resturants to eat in the city & bars to go drinking at. Ferry runs until about 11pm most nights so getting around wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: Davo124
Reviews.Content: The quality and, more importantly, attitude of Harbourside left a lot to be desired. This is a reasonably expensive place to stay, but really we had the feeling that everything was a bit cheap. The good news - the view of the Bridge and Opera House was fantastic - ask for the rooms looking towards the bridge, and try for at least the 7th floor or above. Comfortable king sized bed in the main bedroom. The bad news - furnishings and electronic appliances were quite dated. Small TV, no internet access. There was no air-conditioning (30-35 degrees when we stayed and we sweated at night), nor is there central heating - small plug-in heater in each bedroom (nothing in the lounge, kitchen or bathroom). The pool is outdoors and not heated (limiting the amount of time each year it would be tolerable to swim in). The pool faces east so gets the morning sun, shaded in the afternoon. Car parking is awkward - had trouble getting my car around the corners in the multi-level car park. The cheap - as mentioned, the furnishings were less than expected. You have to ask for the complimentary morning newspaper, although advertised in the tariff. Swimming pool towels not offered. Really, welcome provisions consisted of 6 dry biscuits, the smallest carton of milk possible and awful instant coffee. There was an awful odour around reception for 3 of the 4 days that we stayed. The car park lights weren't working - a bit scary walking to and from the car in the evening in pitch darkness. Other details - the apartments are located on the North Shore of the Harbour, away from the main tourist areas - need to take the ferry across the Harbour for most of the tourist attractions. The nearest restaurants and cafe are about 1 kilometre away, and are of excellent quality (except 1 expensive restaurant on the water's edge, next door - we didn't try it).

Reviews.Title: “A must stay waterfront destination for Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: hoochie_boochies
Reviews.Content: On the North shore in the same bay (opposite side to Luna Park). Walk out the front door of the hotel and there is the Sydney Habour Bridge and Opera House across uninterupted views of the Bridge, Opera House and Sydney CBD. Ferry to circular key leaves 200m from front door, free parking, modern interior easy to get to, fantastic local cafe strip. Perfect location and very reasonable price. Studio apartment was huge for 2 people!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Dzonka
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have stayed at these apartments and they have the absolute BEST view of Sydney. The apartment that we stayed in had been upgraded to a much better arrangement with wooden floors,and a superb kitchen and bathroom. The staff could not have been more helpful. We would not stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “The Views!!”
Reviews.Author: TrishandAndy
Reviews.Content: We cancelled a booking that we had at another apartment hotel after reading bad reviews on Trip Advisor. We then chose Harbourside Apartments from a Sydney Hotel website and checked Trip Advisor for reviews before confirming. If it is a view of Sydney Harbour that you are looking for, these apartments are for you! We booked into a 2 bed apartment and had panoramic views of the whole of Sydney Harbour. The view of the Bridge and Opera House were second to none. The apartment itself was adequate, although this was the middle of Winter in Australia and the heating is individual plug in radiators which were not switched on prior to our arrival. The ferry stops 50 metres from the hotel door so you can get easily to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay without ever getting into a taxi or bus. The hotel provides a packed breakfast which is pretty mediocre, so you really need to make use of the supermarket facilities nearby, or go for breakfast in one of the cafes a short walk away. Darling Harbour has all kinds of restaurants, but all outside, so be prepared to be cold if you go in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: kiddy82
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Sydney before we were worried about the "non city" location - there was absolutely no need to be worried! The hotel is so close to the water and the views were brilliant - the Opera House & Harbour Bridge are literally in your face. We jumped on ferry into the city and then came back to the peace and quiet of the hotel. You have to walk up a few stairs to the closest shop but other than that - no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: BOFFA
Reviews.Content: You seriously cannot get a better view in Sydney. If you book a harbour view apartment you look straight at the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. You catch the ferry to them. 10 minute walk to groovy McMahons Point (2 great pubs & loads of cafes).

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: tripleseven
Reviews.Content: After booking my stay on Wotif I thought that it would be a safe bet...clean and comfy etc. But when I got there I was immediately disappointed. The hotel has no services at all. No cafes or restaurants close by. My room was old and very tired. It smelt horrible (old and musty) and the bathroom was far from clean - in fact the light didn't even work so I had to do my makeup in the lounge room! The bed was comfortable but with very thin blankets that had seen better days. I had trouble sleeping all night as it was so horrible. I even checked the bed for bugs! which gives you the idea of how terrible it was. Strong food smells in the hall way filtered into the apartment as well and made me uncomfortable. I would definitely not recommend this as a place to stay unless you are used to travelling in 2 star type of hotels. This would definitely rate as a 2 star in my opinion - and that is just because of the state of the room.

Reviews.Title: “amazing views but not a high star rating”
Reviews.Author: toby1knobe
Reviews.Content: The location of these apartments is amazing and the best view we have had in Sydney which was even better because of the fact we were there with our two children for the 75th bridge anniversary. However it is not a cheap option and the negative side of the apartments is that they have not been renovated in a five or even four star manner. We had a two bedroomed apartment which looked huge on the website - not so. The furniture had been updated and was reasonable, there was some black mould around the bath in the 'need of updating bathroom', the kitchen was okay but old and in need of renovating also. We wouldnt stay again as we prefer something more up market when on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! this place is a winner”
Reviews.Author: PearlerQueenslander
Reviews.Content: Sydney Harbour in your face all day and all night. Unbelievable. Our apartment was tastefully renovated and very comfortable. Friendly staff. Parked the car for free and used the ferry. Doesn't get much better than this - not anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, in need of updating.”
Reviews.Author: Don64
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again, Our 2 bed apartment was dirty and and worn, although the location was beautiful and the new year fireworks were in good view. The swimming pool was alot smaller than brouchere percieved.

Reviews.Title: “Good city location”
Reviews.Author: helloeverybody
Reviews.Content: We were here in June for 1 week. 2 adults & 2 kids. We found the hotel on a web site "wotif" and had a resonable rate for our stay there. Our 2 bedroom appartment was on the 7th floor with big corner windows which looked out at the harbour bridge and opera house. That was pretty amazing. The rest of the rooms were ok, with a small bathroom. We had a car so it was very good for parking( no charge) and we used the ferries to get to town. It did get very cold in the evenings as the windows are thin and no central heating, although we did get a radiator from the staff there. We would stay there again as it was convenient and easy to get around with the ferries which is great fun in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunate stay...with buggs”
Reviews.Author: claudiocastelluccia
Reviews.Content: dont stay in hotel...bugs in room and bed....gardener rude e noissy.....view and brochure looks good...dont belief...rest terrible..furntiure old and tired....terribkle time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GaryColeman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Habourside apartments for 4 nights in December 2005. AUS$187 per night for a studio apartment with a superb view of the harbour. Apartment was fully equipped with a full kitchen and satellite television. They also provide free tea/coffee, juices and snacks on arrival. Free parking and the ferry wharf is only a 1 minute walk away. Excellent all round.

HotelInfo.Name: Harbourside Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: 2a Henry Lawson Ave | McMahons Point, Sydney, New South Wales 2060 , Australia
